text:
The configure script just doesn't work.  I've put an echo at the beginning and 
it keeps just displaying that message.  In the meantime, it never does any 
actual configuration work.  I've done a very bare-bones call of the script, 
just ./configure --prefix=/usr/local/apache2, I've done a more verbose call, 
e.g. ./configure --prefix=/usr/local/apache2 --verbose --enable-so --enable-
ssl, and I get the same thing every time.

This is starting under bash on Debian 3.0, kernel 2.4.24.

If you need any more info on this bug, please feel free to contact me.
creator: rick@violetshivers.com

text:
What do you mean "at the beginning"?  Please post the exact output of running an
unmodified configure script.  Try running "sh ./configure" to see if that makes
any difference.
creator: jorton@redhat.com

text:
There is no output to show.  Whether I type "sh ./configure" or "./configure", 
it (apparently) just sits there.  I added an echo to the beginning of the 
script (actually all over the script, ) to see what was going on.  That echo 
just keeps getting repeated.  Otherwise there is NO output.

Now, though, after having tried four separate extractions of the archive, on 
the fifth time through, it's working.  Weird.
creator: rick@violetshivers.com
